conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the configuration of the conductor and the magnetic field.
The image depicts an equilateral triangular conductor frame with points A and B connected to a power supply, placed perpendicular to a magnetic field.
The conductor is equilateral, meaning all sides are equal, and thus all sides are subject to the same conditions.
The magnetic field is uniform and perpendicular to the conductor, implying that the Ampere force acts equally on each side.
The Ampere force on a conductor in a magnetic field is given by F = BIL.
Since the conductor is equilateral, the force on each side (AB, BC, CA) is equal.
The resultant force on all three sides is therefore three times the force on one side: 3F.
The question specifies that the resultant force is 3F.
According to the given conditions, the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is 3F.
